final_answer.explanation: The runner-up team in the 1996 Copa CONMEBOL finals was Santa Fe. They are based in Bogotá, Colombia, and their home stadium is El Campín. This information is derived from the context provided, which states that Santa Fe plays their home games at El Campín stadium in Bogotá. graph.title: Locate Lanús Stadium
graph.content: <232>[Locate Lanús Stadium] Determine the stadium where Lanús plays home games.</232>
graph.answer: To identify the stadium where the runner-up team, Lanús, played their home games in the 1996 Copa CONMEBOL finals, we first confirm that Lanús is indeed the team in question. The home stadium of Club Atlético Lanús is the Estadio Ciudad de Lanús – Néstor Díaz Pérez, commonly referred to as Estadio Lanús. This stadium is located in the Lanús district of Greater Buenos Aires, Argentina. Therefore, the task is effectively executed by confirming that the home stadium for Lanús is Estadio Ciudad de Lanús – Néstor Díaz Pérez.

graph.title: Match Team to Stadium
graph.content: <233>[Match Team to Stadium] Cross-reference the runner-up team with their home stadium information.</233>
graph.answer:
To identify the home stadium of the runner-up team in the 1996 Copa CONMEBOL finals, we first confirm that the runner-up team is Lanús, as they were defeated by Santa Fe in the finals. Next, we need to establish where Lanús plays its home games. 

According to the information available, Club Atlético Lanús is based in the Lanús district of Greater Buenos Aires, Argentina. The home stadium of Lanús is known to be Estadio Ciudad de Lanús – Néstor Díaz Pérez. This information is consistent across various reliable sources. 

Thus, we have confirmed that the home stadium of Lanús, the runner-up team in the 1996 Copa CONMEBOL finals, is Estadio Ciudad de Lanús – Néstor Díaz Pérez.
